title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for: g'(x) = f(x)

1 point is earned for the critical points

1 point is earned for the answer with justification

g'(x) = f(x) = 0 at x = 1, 3.

g' changes from negative to positive at x = 1 so g has a relative minimum at x = 1. g' changes from positive to negative at x = 3 so g has a relative maximum at x = 3.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for: g'(x) = f(x)

1 point is earned for the critical points

1 point is earned for the answer with justification

g'(x) = f(x) = 0 at x = 1, 3.

g' changes from negative to positive at x = 1 so g has a relative minimum at x = 1. g' changes from positive to negative at x = 3 so g has a relative maximum at x = 3.

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned for: g'(x) = f(x)

1 point is earned for the critical points

1 point is earned for the answer with justification

g'(x) = f(x) = 0 at x = 1, 3.

g' changes from negative to positive at x = 1 so g has a relative minimum at x = 1. g' changes from positive to negative at x = 3 so g has a relative maximum at x = 3.

The student response earns two of the following points:

1 point is earned for: g'(x) = f(x)

1 point is earned for the critical points

1 point is earned for the answer with justification

g'(x) = f(x) = 0 at x = 1, 3.

g' changes from negative to positive at x = 1 so g has a relative minimum at x = 1. g' changes from positive to negative at x = 3 so g has a relative maximum at x = 3.

The student response earns all of the following points:

1 point is earned for: g'(x) = f(x)

1 point is earned for the critical points

1 point is earned for the answer with justification

g'(x) = f(x) = 0 at x = 1, 3.

g' changes from negative to positive at x = 1 so g has a relative minimum at x = 1. g' changes from positive to negative at x = 3 so g has a relative maximum at x = 3.
